courseDescription: This course is designed to acquaint students with the discipline of speech-language pathology and provide an introduction to developmental and acquired disorders of speech and language.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of developmental and acquired disorders of speech and language
Ability to use assessment tools for communication disorders diagnosis
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with clients and their families
Empathy towards individuals with communication disorders
Active listening skills during speech therapy sessions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical thinking in diagnosing communication disorders
Analyzing speech and language patterns for treatment planning
Problem-solving during therapy sessions for improved communication outcomes
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management in scheduling therapy sessions
Leadership in guiding clients through speech therapy goals
Organizing progress reports for tracking communication disorder improvements

courseTitle: Anatomy of Speech, Language, and Swallowing
courseDescription: Study of the psycholinguistic, acoustic, anatomical, and physiological aspects of speech and language, as well as anatomical and physiological aspects of swallowing.
Technical and Digital Skills: Anatomical knowledge related to speech and language
Knowledge of anatomical and physiological aspects of swallowing
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of complex anatomical concepts
Collaboration with peers on anatomical case studies
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing anatomical structures and their impact on speech production
Identifying physiological factors affecting swallowing function

courseDescription: Study of the production and classification of sounds in American English; practice in phonetic transcription.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of phonetic transcriptions

courseTitle: Neural Bases of Communication and Swallowing Disorders
courseDescription: The content of this course focuses upon the neurological bases of speech, language, and swallowing, and communication and swallowing disorders that result from acquired neuropathologies affecting the central and peripheral nervous system.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of neurological bases of speech, language, and swallowing disorders
Knowledge of acquired neuropathologies affecting the central and peripheral nervous system
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients and healthcare professionals regarding communication and swallowing disorders
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Diagnosis and treatment planning for communication and swallowing disorders based on neurological findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordination of interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive assessment and management of communication and swallowing disorders

courseTitle: Introduction to Language Disorders in Children
courseDescription: This course presents an introduction to the various language disorders manifested by children and adolescents with a focus on characteristics, etiologies and general intervention approaches.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding various language disorders in children
Implementing general intervention approaches for language disorders
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communicating effectively with children with language disorders
Collaborating with parents and caregivers for intervention planning
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing characteristics of language disorders in children
Developing individualized intervention plans based on specific needs of each child
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading intervention teams for children with language disorders
Organizing resources and materials for effective therapy sessions

courseTitle: Clinical Observation and Writing in Communication Sciences and Disorders
courseDescription: Speech-language pathology/audiology students will learn practical and foundational clinical skills necessary for deconstructing speech-language pathology treatment sessions, for identifying important parts-of-speech, and for completing disciplinary writing tasks. Objectives in this class are met using guided observations. This is a writing intensive course.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Observation skills
Writing skills
Guided observation techniques
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing clinical sessions
Identifying key elements in treatment sessions

courseDescription: This course emphasizes causes, identification, and treatment of speech sound disorders.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of speech therapy software applications
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with clients and their families
Collaboration with other healthcare professionals in treatment planning
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying root causes of speech sound disorders
Developing tailored treatment plans based on individual needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading group therapy sessions for speech sound disorders

courseDescription: This course reviews speech and language development from the perspective of the speech-language pathologist.
Technical and Digital Skills: Use of specialized software for speech analysis
Knowledge of electronic medical records systems for documentation
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients and their families
Collaboration with other healthcare professionals in interdisciplinary teams
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing speech and language patterns for diagnosis
Developing customized treatment plans based on assessment findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Providing guidance and supervision to speech therapy assistants

courseDescription: The content of this course focuses upon basic acoustics, speech acoustics, psychoacoustics, speech perception, and clinical laboratory instrumentation.  The course is designed to provide fundamental information regarding normal and abnormal aspects of speech and hearing processes.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of speech and hearing concepts
Collaboration with clinical professionals for research
Presenting findings to diverse audiences
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing normal and abnormal aspects of speech and hearing processes
Identifying patterns in speech perception data
Troubleshooting clinical laboratory instrumentation
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing research projects related to speech and hearing science
Leading a team of researchers in data collection and analysis
Organizing and coordinating speech and hearing conferences

courseDescription: A study of the physics of sound, anatomy, and physiology of the human ear, basic audiometry and hearing disorders.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of anatomy and physiology of the human ear
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Patient communication in audiometry procedures
Explaining hearing disorder diagnosis to patients
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpreting audiometry results
Identifying common hearing disorders based on symptoms
Troubleshooting equipment issues in audiometry
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating with healthcare professionals for patient care

courseDescription: A study of audiological findings and the implications for hearing therapy; speech and language development of the deaf.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients
Collaboration with healthcare professionals
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing audiological findings
Developing personalized therapy plans

courseTitle: Sign Language and Deaf Culture I
courseDescription: Study of the grammatical structure and use of American sign language; exposure to ideals and culture of the deaf community. (This course does not satisfy the general education foreign language skills requirement.)
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with deaf individuals
Active listening skills
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing sign language structures
Interpreting non-verbal communication

courseTitle: Sign Language and Deaf Culture II
courseDescription: Advanced studies of the grammar and symbols of American Sign Language, and appreciation for concepts and issues surrounding deaf culture. (This course does not fulfill the general education foreign language requirement.)
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with the deaf community
Respectful interaction with individuals using sign language
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing complex ASL sentences
Interpreting ASL symbols accurately

courseDescription: The clinical practicum in speech-language pathology takes place off campus, giving students the opportunity to earn clinical hours with an ASHA-certified speech-language pathologist in their final semester. The practicum involves 90 hours, divided between direct and indirect clinical services. A background check is required before students can be placed at the practicum site. Students are required to have a GPA in the major of 3.25 or higher.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Patient communication and rapport building
Interprofessional collaboration with healthcare team
Family counseling and education
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Clinical case analysis and treatment planning
Adaptation to individual patient needs
Data interpretation for progress tracking
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management for clinical hours allocation
Advocacy for patient needs within healthcare system

courseTitle: Independent Study in Communication Sciences and Disorders
courseDescription: Independent study of special topics in communication sciences and disorders.
Technical and Digital Skills: Digital assessment tools in speech therapy
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with clients and families in speech therapy
Collaboration with interdisciplinary teams in healthcare settings
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of research in communication sciences and disorders
Development of intervention strategies based on assessment findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management for independent study projects in communication sciences and disorders
Advocacy for individuals with communication disorders

courseDescription: Supervised research on a specific problem in speech-language pathology. Regular meetings with faculty and a written/oral report are required.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Regular meetings with faculty
Written/oral report presentation
Collaboration with team members
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of research findings
Identifying research gaps
Developing research questions

courseTitle: Clinical Observation and Writing in Communication Sciences and Disorders
courseDescription: Speech-language pathology/audiology students will learn practical and foundational clinical skills necessary for deconstructing speech-language pathology treatment sessions, for identifying important parts-of-speech, and for completing disciplinary writing tasks. Objectives in this class are met using guided observations.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Guided observations in clinical settings
Effective communication with patients and colleagues
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing clinical data
Identifying patterns in speech-language disorders
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading group discussions on clinical cases

courseDescription: This course reviews speech and language development from the perspective of the speech-language pathologist.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of speech and language disorders
Understanding of speech and language development milestones
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with clients and colleagues
Empathy and active listening skills in therapy sessions
Building rapport with clients and families
Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams for holistic care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing speech and language evaluation results
Developing customized treatment plans based on individual needs
Identifying barriers to progress in communication goals
Adjusting therapy techniques for optimal outcomes
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Supervising and mentoring speech therapy assistants
Continuing education to stay updated on best practices in the field

courseDescription: The content of this course focuses upon basic acoustics, speech acoustics, psychoacoustics, speech perception, and clinical laboratory instrumentation.  The course is designed to provide fundamental information regarding normal and abnormal aspects of speech and hearing processes.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients
Team collaboration in clinical settings
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying abnormal speech patterns
Analyzing speech perception data

courseDescription: A study of the physics of sound, anatomy, and physiology of the human ear, basic audiometry and hearing disorders.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective patient communication regarding hearing disorders
Collaboration with audiologists and healthcare professionals
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpreting audiometry results
Identifying common hearing disorders based on test results
Troubleshooting technical issues with audiometry equipment
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing patient appointments for audiometry tests
Ensuring accuracy and compliance in audiometry procedures

courseDescription: A study of audiological findings and the implications for hearing therapy; speech and language development of the deaf.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients
Empathy and active listening skills
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Problem-solving in hearing therapy
Analyzing speech and language development data

courseTitle: Independent Study in Communication Sciences and Disorders
courseDescription: Independent study of special topics in communication sciences and disorders.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data collection techniques in speech-language pathology
Software tools for data analysis in communication sciences
Digital resources for speech therapy research
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective presentation of research findings in communication disorders
Collaborative research communication with peers and mentors
Professional communication with clients or patients in speech-language pathology
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of research literature in communication sciences and disorders
Analyzing data trends in speech therapy outcomes
Identifying research gaps in communication disorders
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Developing research proposals in communication sciences and disorders
Managing independent study timelines and tasks
Leading research projects in speech-language pathology

courseTitle: Evidence Based Practice and Research in Speech-Language Pathology
courseDescription: This course will provide students with a background in evidence-based clinical practice by understanding elements of quality research methods. Students will learn how to identify reputable research outcomes that influence clinical decisions in speech-language pathology.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of research findings
Collaborating with other professionals in the field
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of research findings
Analyzing research data
Making clinical decisions based on evidence

courseDescription: This course teaches students basic clinical procedures and competencies in speech-language pathology with an emphasis on language sampling and identification of grammatical categories, skills required by professionals practicing in the field of speech-language pathology.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients
Collaboration with healthcare professionals
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing language samples for pathology detection
Identifying speech disorders based on clinical procedures

courseTitle: Spoken and Written Language Disorders: School-Aged Children
courseDescription: This course focuses on the relationship between spoken and written language and its role in language-based learning disabilities in school-aged students. It addresses the characteristics of language, reading, and spelling impairments; the subtypes of these disorders; and the different assessment and intervention approaches used with them.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with school-aged children
Collaborating with parents and educators for intervention planning
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing language-based learning disabilities
Developing personalized intervention plans based on assessments

courseDescription: The emphasis of this course is clinical assessment and intervention for phonology and articulation skills that can be disrupted in speech sound disorders including motor speech disorders.
Technical and Digital Skills: Clinical assessment techniques for phonology and articulation
Intervention strategies for speech sound disorders
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with clients and their families regarding speech disorders
Collaboration with other healthcare professionals for comprehensive treatment plans
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing speech patterns to identify specific sound errors
Developing individualized treatment plans based on assessment results
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading therapy sessions with confidence and professionalism

courseTitle: Language Disorders: Birth to Five Years
courseDescription: An advanced study of the diagnosis and intervention for infants and preschoolers with suspected language disorders arising from a variety of etiologies. This course has a particular emphasis on assessment and intervention using principles of evidence-based practice.
Technical and Digital Skills: Diagnosis of language disorders in infants and preschoolers
Intervention strategies for language disorders in young children
Utilizing evidence-based practice in assessment and intervention
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with parents and caregivers regarding language disorders
Collaborating with other professionals in interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing assessment data to determine appropriate intervention strategies
Problem-solving to address language disorders in children with various etiologies
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading and coordinating intervention plans for children with language disorders
Organizing and managing assessment data for effective treatment planning

courseDescription: This course emphasizes the current etiological theories, research, diagnostic procedures, and therapeutic techniques related to voice and resonance disorders.  Students will study terminology and concepts related to the resonance, phonation, and respiration systems underlying voice production.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding etiological theories related to voice and resonance disorders
Utilizing diagnostic procedures for voice disorders
Applying therapeutic techniques for voice disorders
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presenting findings on voice and resonance disorders
Collaborating with colleagues on research projects related to voice disorders
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing terminology and concepts related to voice production systems
Identifying underlying causes of voice and resonance disorders
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading research projects on voice and resonance disorders
Organizing data related to voice disorder cases

courseDescription: This course emphasizes current etiological theories, research, diagnostic procedures and therapeutic techniques related to stuttering.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with clients who stutter
Collaborating with other healthcare professionals in stuttering treatment
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing research on stuttering theories
Developing individualized therapy plans for clients who stutter
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading therapy sessions for clients who stutter
Managing caseloads effectively in stuttering clinics

courseDescription: The objective of this course is to investigate the etiologies, communicative disorders, diagnostic methods and therapeutic techniques related to aphasia, dyslexia and dysgraphia related to acquired neurologic conditions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Therapeutic techniques for aphasia, dyslexia, and dysgraphia
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients with aphasia
Empathy towards individuals with communicative disorders
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Diagnostic evaluation of aphasia, dyslexia, and dysgraphia
Treatment planning based on individual needs

courseDescription: This course reviews the structures and neural bases of swallowing, common etiologies that cause dysphagia, and clinical techniques used in assessment and management of swallowing disorders in pediatric and adult populations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of common etiologies of swallowing disorders
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients and caregivers
Collaboration with multidisciplinary team members in treatment planning
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing swallowing function test results
Identifying appropriate interventions based on assessment findings
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating treatment plans with healthcare providers

courseDescription: This course will identify populations that may benefit from Augmentative and Alternative Communication Disorders (AAC), describe the assessment process relative to AAC and tenets of intervention, provide information regarding legal issues related to AAC, and demonstrate how to acquire and use AAC instrumentation.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with individuals benefiting from AAC
Collaboration with AAC specialists and legal professionals
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying populations that may benefit from AAC
Analyzing assessment results for AAC implementation
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing legal issues related to AAC implementation

courseDescription: Advanced study of the physics of sound, anatomy, and physiology of audition, hearing disorders, and audiometric procedures, providing knowledge and skills necessary for a speech-language pathologist.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients
Explaining audiometric procedures to patients
Collaborating with speech-language pathologists
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpreting audiometric results
Identifying hearing disorders based on test outcomes
Troubleshooting equipment issues during procedures
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading a team in conducting audiometric procedures

courseDescription: The objective of this course is to investigate the etiologies, cognitive impairments, communication manifestations, diagnostic methods and therapeutic techniques related to traumatic brain injury, right hemisphere brain damage, and various dementias.
Technical and Digital Skills: Diagnostic methods for traumatic brain injury
Communication manifestations analysis for various dementias
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients and their families
Collaboration with healthcare professionals in treatment planning
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Etiology analysis for right hemisphere brain damage
Critical evaluation of cognitive impairments in different conditions
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading therapeutic sessions for cognitive rehabilitation

courseTitle: Clinical Perspectives on Autism Spectrum Disorders
courseDescription: Students in this class will study diagnostic and intervention methods necessary for speech-language pathologists treating people diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorders.
Technical and Digital Skills: Diagnostic assessment methods for Autism Spectrum Disorders
Intervention strategies for speech-language pathologists treating individuals with ASD
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with individuals diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorders
Collaboration with multidisciplinary teams for comprehensive care
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing diagnostic results to develop personalized treatment plans
Problem-solving to address communication challenges in individuals with ASD
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading and coordinating treatment plans for individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorders
Organizing and managing therapy sessions effectively

courseTitle: Culturally Sustaining Communication Practices in Speech-Language Pathology
courseDescription: Students will discuss cultural competence as applied in the speech-language pathology clinical process, including a self-examination of bias and effective communication through a culturally-responsive lens.
Technical and Digital Skills: Utilizing digital assessment tools for diverse populations
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Engaging in culturally-responsive communication
Adapting communication strategies for different cultural backgrounds
Effective cross-cultural communication in speech-language pathology
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying biases in clinical practice
Critical analysis of cultural influences on communication disorders
Problem-solving in culturally diverse clinical scenarios
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Creating inclusive communication plans for diverse clients

courseTitle: Theories of Supervision in Speech-Language Pathology
courseDescription: Students will discuss models of effective clinical supervision, with an emphasis on preparation and planning to guide students, clinical fellows, and speech-language pathology assistants.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with students and clinical fellows
Providing constructive feedback
Professional mentoring
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying areas of improvement in supervision techniques
Developing solutions for challenging supervisory situations

courseTitle: Advanced Clinical Externship in Speech-Language Pathology
courseDescription: In this externship, students will apply advanced speech-language pathology techniques in diagnosis and intervention for individuals with communication and swallowing disorders in medical or educational settings. Students will work full time in an off-campus facility to complete clock hours for certification purposes.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients
Collaboration with healthcare professionals
Patient education on treatment plans
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical thinking in diagnosing disorders
Developing individualized treatment plans
Problem-solving in real-world clinical scenarios

courseTitle: Clinical Practicum in Speech-Language Pathology I, II, III
courseDescription: These practica are designed to provide students with experiences in the evaluation and treatment of a variety of communication disorders in children and adults.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients and families
Collaboration with multidisciplinary teams
Empathy and active listening skills
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Diagnostic problem-solving abilities
Treatment planning based on assessment results
Critical thinking in therapy approaches

courseTitle: Independent Study in Communication Sciences and Disorders
courseDescription: Independent study of special topics in communication sciences and disorders.
Technical and Digital Skills: Research methodology in communication sciences and disorders
Data collection techniques in communication disorders research
Use of specialized software for speech analysis
Utilizing electronic databases for literature review in CSD
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with research participants
Collaboration with faculty mentors for study design
Clear and concise scientific writing for research reports
Presentation of research findings in academic settings
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing research data in CSD studies
Identifying trends and patterns in communication disorders research
Critical evaluation of research methodologies in CSD
Developing research questions for independent study
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management for independent study projects
Setting and achieving research goals in CSD
Taking initiative in research design and implementation
Leading research projects in communication sciences and disorders

courseDescription: The content of this course focuses on the neurological bases of speech, disorders of speech production associated with neurologic diseases, as well as methods for evaluation and treatment of those disorders.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with patients
Collaboration with healthcare team members
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Diagnosis of speech disorders based on neurological findings
Developing personalized treatment plans for patients

courseDescription: The content of this course focuses upon the structural and neurological bases of speech disorders, particularly those related to laryngeal and central nervous system pathologies. Advanced expertise in neuromotor speech disorders will be developed along with in depth familiarity and analysis of related literature.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of neurological bases of speech disorders
Analysis of central nervous system pathologies
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to present complex information clearly
Effective communication with patients and colleagues
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of literature related to speech disorders
Identifying patterns in speech pathology cases
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading interdisciplinary teams in speech therapy
